headline: Easy Sausage Gravy and Biscuits
description: This biscuits and gravy recipe with refrigerated jumbo biscuits and homemade creamy sausage gravy is ready in just 15 minutes for a hearty breakfast.

video.name: How to Make Easy Sausage and Gravy Biscuits

name: Easy Sausage Gravy and Biscuits
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) can refrigerated jumbo buttermilk biscuits
1 (9.6 ounce) package Jimmy Dean® Original Hearty Pork Sausage Crumbles
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Arrange biscuits 1 to 2 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 13 to 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook sausage in a large skillet over medium heat until thoroughly heated, stirring frequently, about 5 to 6 minutes.

Stir in flour until well combined. Gradually add milk, stirring continuously, until the gravy thickens and comes to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer and stir for 2 more minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Split biscuits in half. Place 2 halves on each of 8 plates; top with about 1/3 cup gravy.

review.reviewBody: Fast, easy and great tasting.
Taste!

I used 1 lb of regular Jimmy Dean sausage, otherwise followed exactly. Was spicy enough with added salt and pepper. I can tell I will have to add more milk tomorrow when I reheat it- it got plenty thick when cooled. Loved it, will make again.
This was super easy to make and didn’t take up too much time to cook either! I highly recommend this recipe-as I am not a very good cook. LOL!
This is a wonderfully simple recipe to make.
It was easy came out a little thicker than I hoped but still good

Super easy recipe. I did a few tweaks, added 1 1/2 Tablespoons of butter & along with the pepper/salt, onion powder to taste. I used turkey (10) round sausage patties that I tore up after I defrosted. For the flour I used a salad dressing shaker along with the milk before adding it to the sausage so I could ensure no lumps. Lastly used 1% milk. Husband loved it and much healthier than what you get at a restaurant.
Super easy and great for a quick gravy. I used homemade biscuits but still amazing!

My mother always made so many of the dishes she made seem so long and having so much to them. When in fact they were quite the opposite. I was never a big gravy and biscuit person until I tried this. I love it. My family loves it. Definitely a hit.

I made breakfast pizza with this gravy recipe! AMAZING! I just added 1/2 of the amount of milk to make it thicker (adjust to your liking!) Topped it with egg and cheese and it made the perfect meal for anytime of day!
I wasn't a huge biscuits and gravy fan before, but I made this for my husband and we both ended up loving it!
LOVED it! I did not add extra seasoning cuz the Jimmy Dean sausage I used had the perfect taste!
Great recipe! I used 2 cups of milk though! Love it!
The secret sausage gravy ratio is 1/4 cup of flour (Wondra works best), 1/4 cup of fat (butter and or sausage grease) and 2 cups of milk. This is the "golden ratio".

Just about the easiest food to make. This is the classic recipe many Americans, at least in the South, grew up with. Can't really go wrong. The biscuits are secondary to this whole experience. One can use any type of bread one wishes. This is about the gravy. Not to say fluffy, buttery, golden brown biscuits aren't an ideal pair with this, but English Toasting Bread or even a good sourdough works as well. If there is any suggestions I could make it would be that one might want to have some extra milk on hand as this recipe can get a little thick at the end of the cooking stage, and I add a tablespoon of butter before browning the sausage. The extra fat helps with consistency, as I have always found ground sausage just doesn't add that much fat at all. I also use whole milk. This becomes a very rich gravy, as one might imagine. Southern Comfort Breakfast food. :)
I made this last week. Only thing I did was add finely chopped onion with the sausage. We love it. Thank Heavens for canned biscuits.
I make my sausage gravy this way always, but i add a teaspoon of Worcestershire sauce and a dash of cayenne pepper.. this is also a great sauce for pork chops!

I used bacon lard, as suggested, and followed the recipe exactly. Ok, I used less salt. All I could taste was bacon grease and flour. Bummer! I added garlic and onion powder as well as sage. Still didn't help. I read others reviews and decided to try it again, only this time I'll cut it half (way too much of end results) and use a lard/butter combo, use a milk/broth combo (milk's too expensive), and less flour. I had to keep adding milk to get it more gravy like. I'm not giving up, just twerking it again. Thank you for forging the way.
So easy to make. Should have made this for the family sooner. I am a hero in their eyes. Lol. Do this.
This disappears fast in my house. I substitute Mocha mix non dairy creamer for the milk to make it lactose free. I mix the milk & flour with my immersion hand blender first. My go to!

Nice basic recipe. I love Allrecipes for consistently delivering nice easy baseline recipes that I can modify as I like. My main reason for commenting though is to let people know about frozen biscuits. Sure they're not homemade but I like them a lot better than canned. I think it must be the preservatives or something. Eat up!

I HATE making any gravy/sauce from scratch using flour. It ALWAYS clumps and looks nasty. Not this one! So easy and tasty. The flavor is in the sausage. Pick a good one. Jimmy Dean sausage is obviously everyone's first choice, but I used a more affordable, tasty store brand and it came out great. This was the easiest, simplest country gravy recipe EVER. Previously, if I did not have the little packet of gravy mix, I wouldn't dare make sausage and gravy. And don't skimp on the milk. While I would normally use a 2% milk no matter what the recipe called for, the whole milk called for in this recipe may have been what made the difference. I am using this recipe for a school's "Breakfast with Santa", and I have NO worries about how it will turn out.
It was very simple and easy recipe to follow and make
Most delicious came out just right
Easy, fast and delicious!
Perfection and so easy to make and do delish?
Simple but good.
Easy to make even with a 3yr old helping
There was not much grease from sausage so I added a little bit of butter before adding the flour turned out wonderful
Very easy to make and the family loved it. Would make it again!
I Love this very, Easy to make.
Great stuff. I added crushed red pepper.
It's good, I added paprika to it. I would also make the gravy little thicker.
Easy to make! Family loved it!
I've made this exactly for several years now and it's so incredibly good. Make sure you get the Jimmy Dean sausage and leave the grease in the pan.
Delicious! My first attempt at gravy and it came out perfect!
My kids favorite!
This was a very easy recipe to make, not expensive and everyone loved it Add scrambled eggs as a side
This gravy was perfect and so delicious. I just found my go to recipe for sausage and gravy.
Nice flavor and thickness. Super easy.
I used some sausage from a roll of uncooked & browned it then followed the recipe. It was perfect & we enjoyed it!
Quick and easy! Tastes wonderful.
It was very easy to make and really tasty.
This is the first time I have made gravy successfully. Instead of sausage which I had run out of I use bacon. It was very very tasty. Thank you
Perfect recipe for the gravy! I used Bisquick for the biscuits.

I didn’t have enough pork sausage but I had one patty of chicken Italian sausage, so I mixed the two together and it gave the recipe a bit of spice. Very quick and easy to make. Also mixed the flour and milk in a separate bowl, drained out the grease from the sausage then mixed in the flour mixture.

I will admit first off, that I did tweak the recipe, but not by much. I replaced 1 cup of milk with 2 sticks of butter, and used garlic salt instead of plain salt. OMG, knock off Bob Evans! Love it and Will definitely be making it again soon!
I think that this recipe was satisfying and filled me up plus extras to spare
This recipe is absolutely delicious. I used one cup half and half and one cup of milk. I used less sausage. I also cooked a small onion with the sausage. Turned out excellent.
My husband and I enjoyed it! It was very easy to make and he said it was better than restaurants! I also added sausages pieces to it for extra flavor. Plenty of salt and pepper, too!
I love it
Love how creamy it gets. Made mine extra peppery. Homemade biscuits and this gravy is a recipe for perfection.
Been using this recipe for YEARS now. It was one of the first things I felt confident making, knowing for sure it would be great everytime. So simple and beginner friendly. Ultimate comfort food
First time making it I didn't quite understand the instructions but I made it a second time tonight and it turned out amazing:)
I had to use a little more than 1/4 flour
Great recipe. So easy, very delicious. One of my favorites for any meal of the day.

Not enough gravy for the amount of sausage. It was fast and easy but I feel I should have added another cup of milk. I think that may just be my personal preference. Thank you for the recipe! First time making white gravy from scratch.

I'm used to making the sausage gravy and biscuits with the powder sausage gravy mix and the powdered biscuit mix however this recipe here sounds very promisingly delicious I'm going to give it a try thank you so much
Easy to make and very good!!!!
I loved it. Used Hot sausage so it added a bit on zing!
It was perfect. Towards the end I added 4-5 dashes tobasco and course ground pepper.
Simple and delicious. In will make it again and again
Made this recipe as is and it was amazing! The boys just loved it! Will make my own biscuits and gravy from now on
This was such an easy and delicious recipe. It tastes better than many restaurants.
Very simple to make! Tastes really good!
Outstanding gravy!
Loved it. No changes this time . Honestly I don’t know what i could or would add because we really liked it .

I just happened upon this recipe, sausage gravy is very simple but yes, cook a roll of sausage… don’t add the milk quickly stir in your flour and get it nice and brown then add the milk, if you add as soon as you add the flour it’ll taste almost doughy… 😣…. Now, do it all over again but try it with bacon!!! My favorite!!
I added more flower and milk to increase the amount bc I have a larger family. I also use the Pillsbury frozen biscuits. Good quick recipe!
Substituted spicy sausage gravy and served it over toast. Definitley needs more liquid. Is very thick as written.
It was an easy suasage gravy recipe. The only change we made was adding a bit of slap yo momma in place of salt and pepper
I think it was totally great perfectly laid out easy to follow
Love this, easy, and a fav of my family every time!

This recipe is super simple, and great for beginners. The steps are clear and concise and leave very little margin for error. My family and church absolutely LOVE biscuits and gravy. We do use Bob Evans sausage instead of Jimmy Dean (flavor preference) .... and it comes out incredible Every. Single. Time.
Enjoyed it! Did use J.P.'s Big Daddy Biscuit recipe (my favorite), and added garlic and onion powders, as well as just under a teaspoon of chili powder.
New favorite! The whole family loved it. This will be a frequent go-to breakfast dinner! :-)
I used a 1 lb roll of Jimmy deans sausage and because it was more sausage I added a 1/2 cup more milk and 1/8 cup more flour. It turned out great 😊

I made this with some alterations. I used ground pork and bacon and used the bacon grease for the gravy. I also added onion powder and garlic powder. Its still really good! Going to add some cheese on top too! So far so good and its super easy to make.

Simple, hearty, delicious. This actually came out a bit too thick per directions so I added another half cup of milk and a pinch of some herb or another might've taken this to the next level, but this was readily devoured as it is. I'll definitely be making more the next time I want a breakfast to stick to my ribs.
This was so fast, but still made a very satisfying meal. With side veggies, of course.
Added butter to the sausage and flour mixture. Then milk to thicken it up.
This was so good and so easy. I will be making this once a month for breakfast. No salt is even needed just a little pepper.
Really easy to follow. Added black pepper to mine!
Great recipe! Guys loved it!
This is so simple and good! A keeper for sure!
Ok
I made the very simple sausage gravy exactly and shows and it was great. I will definitely make this gravy again I will be my go to recipe for now own.
Great tastes amazing.
Easy Peasy!!!
😋 really good. Will not buy anymore pack sausage gravy.
This was so easy to make and tastes good.
Very simple yet tasty recipe. I added a little more milk than the recipe called for because I wanted it to be a little thinner. Followed the recipe as written otherwise.
Was absolutely delicious! Will make it again.
I love b and g this being my first time ever actually making it was delicious
love it super simple kids love it i love it wife loves it

I didn’t like the crumbled sausage taste. The next time I will use 
Jimmy Dean bulk sausage
We don’t eat pork, so I used turkey sausage, & I added some extra seasonings. I was a hit for family brunch.
Perfect
